subsection_name: benh-san-la-gan.json_6_What factors increase the risk of liver fluke infection?
subsection_content:
Besides the above causes of the disease, subjective and objective factors also contribute to increasing the risk of liver fluke infection such as water pollution discharged by infected cattle slaughterhouses, close exposure to between humans and livestock, uncontrolled import of livestock from countries with epidemics... polluted living environment.
See more: Summary of viral and parasitic diseases
